champ.champInfo:
The general management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out by the Public Organization "All-Ukrainian Association "Kyokushin BuDo Karate" The direct holding of the competition is entrusted to the Zakarpattia Regional Federation of Kyokushin BuDo Karate and the Main Board of Judges approved by the KBDK

Organizing committee and judges:

  • The chief judge of the competition is Ihor Shandra, judge of the national sensei category, 3rd Dan, Uzhgorod
  • Chairman of the panel of judges - Shikhan Leonid Chernyavskyi, 5th Dan, Kherson
  • Technical support — Ihor Tatarchenko (Lviv)

Registration

Registration for participation in the competition takes place through a personal account until April 5, 2024. Or to the e-mail of the organizing committee:
igor.shandra92@gmail.com або Tatarchenkoiu@ukr.net
Contact numbers:
Ihor Shandra: +38 (095) 924-67-97
Ihor Tatarchenko: +38 (067)-788-77-28

The date and place of the competition

The competition is held in Uzhhorod
Date of arrival - April 20, 2024.
Venue - Uzhhorod, st. Zankovetska, 5, SK "Yunist"
Competition starts on April 21 at 08:00

Competition program

April 20 (Saturday):

  • 14:00 – 19:00 mandate and medical commission, weighing of participants
  • 19:00 - 21:00 judges' seminar, formation of judges' teams

April 21 (Sunday):

  • 07:30 – 07:45 briefing for the competition secretariat and service personnel
  • 07:45 – 08:00 meeting with team representatives
  • 08:00 - 11:00 competition in the "kata" section
  • 11:00 - 11:30 ceremonial opening of the competition, parade of participants
  • 11:30 - 14:00 start of competition in the "kumite" section
  • 14:00 - 14:30 break
  • 14:30 - 18:00 continuation of the competition in the "kumite" section
  • 18:00 - 19:00 awarding of winners and prize-winners of the competition, closing of the competition

Competition participants.

  • To participate in the Championship of Ukraine, national teams of regions and the city of Kyiv, which are members of the KBDC, as well as invited teams of other federations, associations, clubs, etc., are allowed. Age categories of competition participants: boys, young men, juniors, girls, girls, juniors, men, women and veterans
  • Competitors must have a sports qualification of at least 8 kyu
  • All participants must submit the following documents to the mandate commission
    • Name application for participation according to the established form, approved by the medical and physical culture dispensary (Appendix 1)
    • birth certificate or passport
    • statement signed by parents regarding permission to participate in competitions for minors (Appendix 2)
    • statement signed by the participant of the competition regarding the waiver of claims for adults (Appendix 3)
    • insurance policy of voluntary health insurance
    • registration of training on life safety techniques for competition participants (Appendix 4)
  • Participants compete in the appropriate form and mandatory personal protective protectors in accordance with the rules of WKB Kyokushin BuDo karate competitions in force in Ukraine
    • personal protectors in age categories up to 18 years: helmet, shin and foot protectors, groin protector, hand protectors. For girls, additionally: breast protector, which is worn under a white T-shirt and does not cover the solar plexus. Breast protection should be made of soft materials, not hard plastic
    • personal protectors in the age category over 18 years: groin protector.For women, additionally: breast protectors, which are worn under a white T-shirt and do not cover the solar plexus. Breast protection should be made of soft materials, not hard plastic
    • personal protectors in the category of veterans: helmet (optional), shin and foot protectors, groin protector, hand protectors
    • knee protection in all categories as desired
    • not allowed to use helmets that have protection (net) in front
    • protective equipment is personal and mandatory
    • if an athlete is not in the necessary equipment 1 minute after being called to a match, he will be awarded a defeat
  • The absence of a team representative for refereeing deprives the representative of such a team from filing any appeals regarding the organization of the tournament, the conduct of matches and the decisions made after them
  • If, based on previous applications, an insufficient number of participants is determined for high-quality holding of competitions in certain categories, the Organizing Committee may make the following changes to the Regulations on these competitions:
    • combine bordering weight categories
    • hold competitions in specified weight categories according to the round system
  • Composition of the team
    • any number of participants in each weight category, 2 judges, 1 representative is mandatory. Referee uniform: white shirt with short sleeves, dark blue tie, dark pants, personal whistle
    • judges and team representatives must take part in the referee seminar on the eve of the tournament.After passing the seminar, a special badge is issued, which entitles the judge and the team representative to be admitted to the tatami together with the participant

Age categories in the "kata" section:
Age Gender 1st circle 2nd circle 3rd circle
8 - 9 Boys/Girls Taikioku sono san Pinan sono san, Pinan sono yon Kata of the second round, which was not shown
10 - 11 Boys/Girls Taikioku sono san Pinan sono san, Pinan sono yon Kata of the second round, which was not shown

Financing

Expenses for the organization and conduct of competitions (awards of winners and prize-winners, rental of sports facilities and auxiliary premises, rental of tatami mats and office equipment, oplaand stationery, medicines, medical and service personnel, printing of posters, programs and other paraphernalia for the competition, placement of advertisements, transport and other expenses for the organization of the competition) are carried out at the expense of the Transcarpathian Regional Federation of Kyokushin Karate, interested institutions, organizations and sponsors

Awards

Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded medals, diplomas and cups of the corresponding degrees
Teams that took 1-3 places are awarded with diplomas and cups of the respective degrees
